content.thinking: The user wants me to check tasks.md and report the task status. Let me read the tasks.md file to analyze the status of all tasks.

1→# Tasks: Runtime Library System
     2→
     3→**Input**: Design documents from `/specs/001-runtime-library-system/`
     4→**Prerequisites**: plan.md (required), spec.md (required), research.md, data-model.md, contracts/
     5→
     6→**Tests**: Included per Constitution principle VII (TDD requirement).
     7→
     8→**Organization**: Tasks are grouped by user story to enable independent implementation and testing.
     9→
    10→## Format: `[ID] [P?] [Story] Description`
    11→
    12→- **[P]**: Can run in parallel (different files, no dependencies)
    13→- **[Story]**: Which user story (US1, US2, US3)
    14→- Include exact file paths in descriptions
    15→
    16→---
    17→
    18→## Phase 1: Setup (Shared Infrastructure) ✅ COMPLETE
    19→
    20→**Purpose**: Project initialization and new module structure
    21→
    22→- [x] T001 Create src/clysm/runtime/ directory structure
    23→- [x] T002 Create src/clysm/runtime/package.lisp with runtime library package definition
    24→- [x] T003 Create src/clysm/compiler/codegen/primitives.lisp with empty registry structure
    25→- [x] T004 [P] Create tests/contract/runtime/ directory structure
    26→- [x] T005 [P] Create tests/unit/runtime/ directory structure
    27→- [x] T006 [P] Create tests/integration/runtime/ directory structure
    28→- [x] T007 Update clysm.asd to include new runtime module with component order
    29→
    30→---
    31→
    32→## Phase 2: Foundational (Blocking Prerequisites) ✅ COMPLETE
    33→
    34→**Purpose**: Core primitives registry that MUST be complete before user stories
    35→
    36→**✅ CHECKPOINT PASSED**: 24 primitives registered. `(list-primitives)` returns 24 entries.
    37→
    38→### Tests for Foundational Phase
    39→
    40→- [x] T008 [P] Contract test for primitive struct in tests/contract/runtime/primitives-struct-test.lisp
    41→- [x] T009 [P] Contract test for registry hash-table in tests/contract/runtime/registry-test.lisp
    42→- [x] T010 [P] Unit test for register-primitive in tests/unit/runtime/register-test.lisp
    43→- [x] T011 [P] Unit test for get-primitive and primitive-p in tests/unit/runtime/lookup-test.lisp
    44→
    45→### Implementation for Foundational Phase
    46→
    47→- [x] T012 Define primitive struct (name, wasm-emitter, signature, inline-p, category) in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/primitives.lisp
    48→- [x] T013 Implement *primitives-registry* hash-table in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/primitives.lisp
    49→- [x] T014 Implement register-primitive function in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/primitives.lisp
    50→- [x] T015 Implement get-primitive function in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/primitives.lisp
    51→- [x] T016 Implement primitive-p predicate in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/primitives.lisp
    52→- [x] T017 [P] Implement list-primitives introspection function in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/primitives.lisp
    53→- [x] T018 Register memory primitives (cons, car, cdr, rplaca, rplacd) in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/primitives.lisp
    54→- [x] T019 [P] Register type predicates (consp, null, numberp, stringp, symbolp) in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/primitives.lisp
    55→- [x] T020 [P] Register arithmetic primitives (+, -, *, /, mod, <, >, =, <=, >=) in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/primitives.lisp
    56→- [x] T021 [P] Register FFI primitives (%host-write-char, %host-write-string, %host-read-char, %host-read-line) in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/primitives.lisp
    57→
    58→**Checkpoint**: All primitives registered. Verify with `(list-primitives)` returning 20+ entries.
    59→
    60→---
    61→
    62→## Phase 3: User Story 1 - Add New Standard Function (Priority: P1) ✅ COMPLETE
    63→
    64→**Goal**: Enable developers to add runtime library functions using Lisp source that compile to Wasm
    65→
    66→**Independent Test**: Add `assoc` to runtime library, verify it compiles to valid Wasm and executes correctly
    67→
    68→### Tests for User Story 1
    69→
    70→- [x] T022 [P] [US1] Contract test for runtime module loading in tests/contract/runtime/module-load-test.lisp
    71→- [x] T023 [P] [US1] Contract test for dependency analysis in tests/contract/runtime/dependency-test.lisp
    72→- [x] T024 [P] [US1] Contract test for Wasm validation in tests/contract/runtime/wasm-valid-test.lisp
    73→- [x] T025 [P] [US1] Unit test for runtime-function struct in tests/unit/runtime/function-struct-test.lisp
    74→- [x] T026 [P] [US1] Unit test for compile-runtime-function in tests/unit/runtime/compile-fn-test.lisp
    75→- [x] T027 [P] [US1] Unit test for undefined primitive detection in tests/unit/runtime/undefined-prim-test.lisp
    76→- [x] T028 [US1] Integration test for assoc compilation and execution in tests/integration/runtime/assoc-test.lisp
    77→
    78→### Implementation for User Story 1
    79→
    80→- [x] T029 [US1] Define runtime-function struct (name, lambda-list, body, source-file, compiled-index, dependencies) in src/clysm/runtime/rt-package.lisp
    81→- [x] T030 [US1] Define runtime-module struct (name, source-file, functions, exports) in src/clysm/runtime/rt-package.lisp
    82→- [x] T031 [US1] Implement load-runtime-source to read and parse runtime .lisp files in src/clysm/runtime/loader.lisp
    83→- [x] T032 [US1] Implement analyze-dependencies to compute function dependency graph in src/clysm/runtime/loader.lisp
    84→- [x] T033 [US1] Implement topological-sort for compilation order in src/clysm/runtime/loader.lisp
    85→- [x] T034 [US1] Integrate primitive-p check into compile-call for function resolution in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
    86→- [x] T035 [US1] Implement undefined-primitive-error and circular-dependency-error conditions in src/clysm/runtime/loader.lisp
    87→- [x] T036 [US1] Implement compile-runtime-function using existing compile-form in src/clysm/runtime/compiler.lisp
    88→- [x] T037 [US1] Implement compile-runtime-module to compile all functions in dependency order in src/clysm/runtime/compiler.lisp
    89→- [x] T038 [US1] Implement merge-runtime-module to combine runtime Wasm with user Wasm in src/clysm/runtime/compiler.lisp
    90→- [x] T039 [P] [US1] Create src/clysm/runtime/list-ops.lisp with [assoc](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_assocc.htm) implementation
    91→- [x] T040 [P] [US1] Add [member](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_mem_m.htm) to src/clysm/runtime/list-ops.lisp
    92→- [x] T041 [P] [US1] Add [find](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_find_.htm) to src/clysm/runtime/list-ops.lisp
    93→- [x] T042 [P] [US1] Add [position](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_pos_p.htm) to src/clysm/runtime/list-ops.lisp
    94→- [x] T043 [US1] Add [nth](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_nth.htm) and [nthcdr](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_nthcdr.htm) to src/clysm/runtime/list-ops.lisp
    95→- [x] T044 [US1] Validate list-ops.lisp compiles with wasm-tools validate
    96→
    97→**Checkpoint**: Developer can add new function to runtime library and it appears in Wasm output. ✅ PASSED
    98→- 14 functions loaded from list-ops.lisp
    99→- Dependency analysis correct (nth → nthcdr)
   100→- Topological sort produces valid compilation order
   101→
   102→---
   103→
   104→## Phase 4: User Story 2 - Migrate I/O Functions (Priority: P2)
   105→
   106→**Goal**: Migrate I/O functions from func-section.lisp to runtime library, achieving 40% line reduction
   107→
   108→**Independent Test**: Compile program using `princ`, verify output matches original behavior, measure line reduction
   109→
   110→### Tests for User Story 2
   111→
   112→- [ ] T045 [P] [US2] Contract test for I/O primitives validation in tests/contract/runtime/io-primitives-test.lisp
   113→- [ ] T046 [P] [US2] Migration parity test for terpri in tests/integration/runtime/terpri-parity-test.lisp
   114→- [ ] T047 [P] [US2] Migration parity test for write-char in tests/integration/runtime/write-char-parity-test.lisp
   115→- [ ] T048 [P] [US2] Migration parity test for write-string in tests/integration/runtime/write-string-parity-test.lisp
   116→- [ ] T049 [P] [US2] Migration parity test for princ in tests/integration/runtime/princ-parity-test.lisp
   117→- [ ] T050 [P] [US2] Migration parity test for prin1 in tests/integration/runtime/prin1-parity-test.lisp
   118→- [ ] T051 [P] [US2] Migration parity test for print in tests/integration/runtime/print-parity-test.lisp
   119→- [ ] T052 [P] [US2] Migration parity test for format in tests/integration/runtime/format-parity-test.lisp
   120→- [ ] T053 [US2] Line count baseline test to verify 40% reduction in tests/integration/runtime/linecount-test.lisp
   121→
   122→### Implementation for User Story 2
   123→
   124→- [ ] T054 [US2] Create src/clysm/runtime/io.lisp with package header and stream utilities
   125→- [ ] T055 [US2] Implement [terpri](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_terpri.htm) in src/clysm/runtime/io.lisp using %host-write-char
   126→- [ ] T056 [US2] Implement [write-char](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_wr_cha.htm) in src/clysm/runtime/io.lisp using %host-write-char
   127→- [ ] T057 [US2] Implement [write-string](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_wr_stg.htm) in src/clysm/runtime/io.lisp using %host-write-string
   128→- [ ] T058 [US2] Implement [princ](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_wr_pr.htm) in src/clysm/runtime/io.lisp with type dispatch
   129→- [ ] T059 [US2] Implement [prin1](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_wr_pr.htm) in src/clysm/runtime/io.lisp with escape sequences
   130→- [ ] T060 [US2] Implement [print](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_wr_pr.htm) in src/clysm/runtime/io.lisp using prin1 + terpri
   131→- [ ] T061 [US2] Implement [write](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_wr_pr.htm) in src/clysm/runtime/io.lisp with keyword support
   132→- [ ] T062 [US2] Implement [format](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_format.htm) in src/clysm/runtime/io.lisp with directive parsing
   133→- [ ] T063 [US2] Remove compile-terpri codegen from src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
   134→- [ ] T064 [US2] Remove compile-write-char codegen from src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
   135→- [ ] T065 [US2] Remove compile-write-string codegen from src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
   136→- [ ] T066 [US2] Remove compile-princ codegen from src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
   137→- [ ] T067 [US2] Remove compile-prin1 codegen from src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
   138→- [ ] T068 [US2] Remove compile-print codegen from src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
   139→- [ ] T069 [US2] Remove compile-write codegen from src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
   140→- [ ] T070 [US2] Remove compile-format codegen from src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
   141→- [ ] T071 [US2] Update function dispatch in compile-call to use runtime I/O functions
   142→- [ ] T072 [US2] Verify func-section.lisp line count < 11,000 (40% reduction from 18,229)
   143→- [ ] T073 [US2] Validate io.lisp compiles with wasm-tools validate
   144→
   145→**Checkpoint**: All I/O functions migrated. `wc -l func-section.lisp` shows <11,000 lines.
   146→
   147→---
   148→
   149→## Phase 5: User Story 3 - Bootstrap Self-Hosting (Priority: P3)
   150→
   151→**Goal**: Complete runtime library with all functions needed for compiler self-hosting
   152→
   153→**Independent Test**: Run `sbcl --load build/stage1-complete.lisp` and verify compilation rate increase
   154→
   155→### Tests for User Story 3
   156→
   157→- [ ] T074 [P] [US3] Contract test for sequence operations Wasm validity in tests/contract/runtime/sequence-wasm-test.lisp
   158→- [ ] T075 [P] [US3] Contract test for string operations Wasm validity in tests/contract/runtime/strings-wasm-test.lisp
   159→- [ ] T076 [P] [US3] Unit test for remove/remove-if in tests/unit/runtime/remove-test.lisp
   160→- [ ] T077 [P] [US3] Unit test for count/count-if in tests/unit/runtime/count-test.lisp
   161→- [ ] T078 [P] [US3] Unit test for substitute in tests/unit/runtime/substitute-test.lisp
   162→- [ ] T079 [P] [US3] Unit test for princ-to-string/prin1-to-string in tests/unit/runtime/to-string-test.lisp
   163→- [ ] T080 [US3] Integration test for Stage 1 compilation rate in tests/integration/runtime/stage1-rate-test.lisp
   164→
   165→### Implementation for User Story 3
   166→
   167→- [ ] T081 [US3] Create src/clysm/runtime/sequences.lisp with package header
   168→- [ ] T082 [US3] Implement [remove](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_rm_rm.htm) in src/clysm/runtime/sequences.lisp
   169→- [ ] T083 [US3] Implement [remove-if](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_rm_rm.htm) in src/clysm/runtime/sequences.lisp
   170→- [ ] T084 [US3] Implement [count](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_countc.htm) in src/clysm/runtime/sequences.lisp
   171→- [ ] T085 [US3] Implement [count-if](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_countc.htm) in src/clysm/runtime/sequences.lisp
   172→- [ ] T086 [US3] Implement [substitute](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_sbs_s.htm) in src/clysm/runtime/sequences.lisp
   173→- [ ] T087 [US3] Create src/clysm/runtime/strings.lisp with package header
   174→- [ ] T088 [US3] Implement [princ-to-string](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_wr_to_.htm) in src/clysm/runtime/strings.lisp
   175→- [ ] T089 [US3] Implement [prin1-to-string](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_wr_to_.htm) in src/clysm/runtime/strings.lisp
   176→- [ ] T090 [US3] Implement [write-to-string](resources/HyperSpec/Body/f_wr_to_.htm) in src/clysm/runtime/strings.lisp
   177→- [ ] T091 [US3] Validate sequences.lisp compiles with wasm-tools validate
   178→- [ ] T092 [US3] Validate strings.lisp compiles with wasm-tools validate
   179→- [ ] T093 [US3] Run `sbcl --load build/stage1-complete.lisp` and measure compilation rate
   180→- [ ] T094 [US3] Verify Stage 1 compilation rate increases by at least 10 percentage points
   181→
   182→**Checkpoint**: Runtime library complete. Stage 1 compilation rate improved toward self-hosting.
   183→
   184→---
   185→
   186→## Phase 6: Polish & Cross-Cutting Concerns
   187→
   188→**Purpose**: Performance validation, documentation, cleanup
   189→
   190→- [ ] T095 [P] Run benchmark comparing old codegen vs runtime library performance
   191→- [ ] T096 [P] Verify build time increase <20% per SC-006
   192→- [ ] T097 [P] Add HyperSpec links to all runtime function docstrings per Constitution IX
   193→- [ ] T098 [P] Update CLAUDE.md with runtime library module documentation
   194→- [ ] T099 Run full test suite: `sbcl --eval "(asdf:test-system :clysm)"`
   195→- [ ] T100 Run quickstart.md validation steps
   196→
   197→---
   198→
   199→## Dependencies & Execution Order
   200→
   201→### Phase Dependencies
   202→
   203→- **Phase 1 (Setup)**: No dependencies - can start immediately
   204→- **Phase 2 (Foundational)**: Depends on Phase 1 - BLOCKS all user stories
   205→- **Phase 3 (US1)**: Depends on Phase 2 completion
   206→- **Phase 4 (US2)**: Depends on Phase 2 (can run parallel to US1 if staffed)
   207→- **Phase 5 (US3)**: Depends on Phase 2 (US1 and US2 provide foundation but not strict blocker)
   208→- **Phase 6 (Polish)**: Depends on all user stories
   209→
   210→### User Story Dependencies
   211→
   212→- **US1 (P1)**: Only depends on Foundational phase - can be MVP
   213→- **US2 (P2)**: Independent of US1, both use primitives registry
   214→- **US3 (P3)**: Independent of US1/US2, but benefits from their patterns
   215→
   216→### Within Each User Story
   217→
   218→- Tests written FIRST, must FAIL before implementation
   219→- Structs/models before loaders
   220→- Loaders before compilers
   221→- Individual functions can be parallel within a module
   222→- Validation last
   223→
   224→### Parallel Opportunities
   225→
   226→**Phase 1**:
   227→- T004, T005, T006 (directory creation) in parallel
   228→
   229→**Phase 2**:
   230→- T008-T011 (all tests) in parallel
   231→- T019, T020, T021 (primitive registration by category) in parallel
   232→
   233→**Phase 3 (US1)**:
   234→- T022-T027 (all tests) in parallel
   235→- T039-T042 (list function implementations) in parallel
   236→
   237→**Phase 4 (US2)**:
   238→- T045-T052 (parity tests) in parallel
   239→- T063-T070 (codegen removal) sequentially (same file)
   240→
   241→**Phase 5 (US3)**:
   242→- T074-T079 (all tests) in parallel
   243→
   244→---
   245→
   246→## Parallel Example: User Story 1
   247→
   248→```bash
   249→# Launch all US1 tests together:
   250→Task: "T022 [P] [US1] Contract test for runtime module loading"
   251→Task: "T023 [P] [US1] Contract test for dependency analysis"
   252→Task: "T024 [P] [US1] Contract test for Wasm validation"
   253→Task: "T025 [P] [US1] Unit test for runtime-function struct"
   254→Task: "T026 [P] [US1] Unit test for compile-runtime-function"
   255→Task: "T027 [P] [US1] Unit test for undefined primitive detection"
   256→
   257→# After tests pass, launch list function implementations together:
   258→Task: "T039 [P] [US1] Create list-ops.lisp with assoc"
   259→Task: "T040 [P] [US1] Add member to list-ops.lisp"
   260→Task: "T041 [P] [US1] Add find to list-ops.lisp"
   261→Task: "T042 [P] [US1] Add position to list-ops.lisp"
   262→```
   263→
   264→---
   265→
   266→## Implementation Strategy
   267→
   268→### MVP First (User Story 1 Only)
   269→
   270→1. Complete Phase 1: Setup (T001-T007)
   271→2. Complete Phase 2: Foundational (T008-T021)
   272→3. Complete Phase 3: User Story 1 (T022-T044)
   273→4. **STOP and VALIDATE**: Add `assoc` to runtime, verify Wasm compiles
   274→5. Demonstrate: New functions can be added without touching func-section.lisp
   275→
   276→### Incremental Delivery
   277→
   278→1. Setup + Foundational → Primitives registry ready
   279→2. User Story 1 → Can add runtime functions → **MVP!**
   280→3. User Story 2 → I/O migrated, 40% line reduction → Major milestone
   281→4. User Story 3 → Self-hosting enabled → Bootstrap goal achieved
   282→
   283→### Success Metrics
   284→
   285→| Metric | Target | Verification |
   286→|--------|--------|--------------|
   287→| SC-001 | func-section.lisp < 11,000 lines | `wc -l func-section.lisp` |
   288→| SC-002 | Add function without codegen changes | Add new runtime function |
   289→| SC-003 | Migrated functions pass tests | `rove tests/integration/runtime/` |
   290→| SC-004 | Stage 1 rate +10 points | `sbcl --load build/stage1-complete.lisp` |
   291→| SC-006 | Build time increase <20% | Stage 1 timing comparison |
   292→
   293→---
   294→
   295→## Notes
   296→
   297→- [P] tasks = different files, no dependencies
   298→- [Story] label maps task to specific user story
   299→- Constitution VII requires TDD: tests MUST fail before implementation
   300→- HyperSpec links required per Constitution IX
   301→- Commit after each task or logical group
   302→- Stop at any checkpoint to validate independently
   303→

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

file.content:
# Tasks: Runtime Library System

**Input**: Design documents from `/specs/001-runtime-library-system/`
**Prerequisites**: plan.md (required), spec.md (required), research.md, data-model.md, contracts/

**Tests**: Included per Constitution principle VII (TDD requirement).

**Organization**: Tasks are grouped by user story to enable independent implementation and testing.

## Format: `[ID] [P?] [Story] Description`

- **[P]**: Can run in parallel (different files, no dependencies)
- **[Story]**: Which user story (US1, US2, US3)
- Include exact file paths in descriptions

---

## Phase 1: Setup (Shared Infrastructure) ✅ COMPLETE

**Purpose**: Project initialization and new module structure

- [x] T001 Create src/clysm/runtime/ directory structure
- [x] T002 Create src/clysm/runtime/package.lisp with runtime library package definition
- [x] T003 Create src/clysm/compiler/codegen/primitives.lisp with empty registry structure
- [x] T004 [P] Create tests/contract/runtime/ directory structure
- [x] T005 [P] Create tests/unit/runtime/ directory structure
- [x] T006 [P] Create tests/integration/runtime/ directory structure
- [x] T007 Update clysm.asd to include new runtime module with component order

---

## Phase 2: Foundational (Blocking Prerequisites) ✅ COMPLETE

**Purpose**: Core primitives registry that MUST be complete before user stories

**✅ CHECKPOINT PASSED**: 24 primitives registered. `(list-primitives)` returns 24 entries.

### Tests for Foundational Phase

- [x] T008 [P] Contract test for primitive struct in tests/contract/runtime/primitives-struct-test.lisp
- [x] T009 [P] Contract test for registry hash-table in tests/contract/runtime/registry-test.lisp
- [x] T010 [P] Unit test for register-primitive in tests/unit/runtime/register-test.lisp
- [x] T011 [P] Unit test for get-primitive and primitive-p in tests/unit/runtime/lookup-test.lisp

### Implementation for Foundational Phase

- [x] T012 Define primitive struct (name, wasm-emitter, signature, inline-p, category) in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/primitives.lisp
- [x] T013 Implement *primitives-registry* hash-table in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/primitives.lisp
- [x] T014 Implement register-primitive function in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/primitives.lisp
- [x] T015 Implement get-primitive function in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/primitives.lisp
- [x] T016 Implement primitive-p predicate in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/primitives.lisp
- [x] T017 [P] Implement list-primitives introspection function in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/primitives.lisp
- [x] T018 Register memory primitives (cons, car, cdr, rplaca, rplacd) in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/primitives.lisp
- [x] T019 [P] Register type predicates (consp, null, numberp, stringp, symbolp) in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/primitives.lisp
- [x] T020 [P] Register arithmetic primitives (+, -, *, /, mod, <, >, =, <=, >=) in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/primitives.lisp
- [x] T021 [P] Register FFI primitives (%host-write-char, %host-write-string, %host-read-char, %host-read-line) in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/primitives.lisp

**Checkpoint**: All primitives registered. Verify with `(list-primitives)` returning 20+ entries.

---

## Phase 3: User Story 1 - Add New Standard Function (Priority: P1) ✅ COMPLETE

**Goal**: Enable developers to add runtime library functions using Lisp source that compile to Wasm

**Independent Test**: Add `assoc` to runtime library, verify it compiles to valid Wasm and executes correctly

### Tests for User Story 1

- [x] T022 [P] [US1] Contract test for runtime module loading in tests/contract/runtime/module-load-test.lisp
- [x] T023 [P] [US1] Contract test for dependency analysis in tests/contract/runtime/dependency-test.lisp
- [x] T024 [P] [US1] Contract test for Wasm validation in tests/contract/runtime/wasm-valid-test.lisp
- [x] T025 [P] [US1] Unit test for runtime-function struct in tests/unit/runtime/function-struct-test.lisp
- [x] T026 [P] [US1] Unit test for compile-runtime-function in tests/unit/runtime/compile-fn-test.lisp
- [x] T027 [P] [US1] Unit test for undefined primitive detection in tests/unit/runtime/undefined-prim-test.lisp
- [x] T028 [US1] Integration test for assoc compilation and execution in tests/integration/runtime/assoc-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 1

- [x] T029 [US1] Define runtime-function struct (name, lambda-list, body, source-file, compiled-index, dependencies) in src/clysm/runtime/rt-package.lisp

## Phase 6: Polish & Cross-Cutting Concerns

**Purpose**: Performance validation, documentation, cleanup

- [ ] T095 [P] Run benchmark comparing old codegen vs runtime library performance
- [ ] T096 [P] Verify build time increase <20% per SC-006
- [ ] T097 [P] Add HyperSpec links to all runtime function docstrings per Constitution IX
- [ ] T098 [P] Update CLAUDE.md with runtime library module documentation
- [ ] T099 Run full test suite: `sbcl --eval "(asdf:test-system :clysm)"`
- [ ] T100 Run quickstart.md validation steps

---

## Dependencies & Execution Order

### Phase Dependencies

- **Phase 1 (Setup)**: No dependencies - can start immediately
- **Phase 2 (Foundational)**: Depends on Phase 1 - BLOCKS all user stories
- **Phase 3 (US1)**: Depends on Phase 2 completion
- **Phase 4 (US2)**: Depends on Phase 2 (can run parallel to US1 if staffed)
- **Phase 5 (US3)**: Depends on Phase 2 (US1 and US2 provide foundation but not strict blocker)
- **Phase 6 (Polish)**: Depends on all user stories

### User Story Dependencies

- **US1 (P1)**: Only depends on Foundational phase - can be MVP
- **US2 (P2)**: Independent of US1, both use primitives registry
- **US3 (P3)**: Independent of US1/US2, but benefits from their patterns

### Within Each User Story

- Tests written FIRST, must FAIL before implementation
- Structs/models before loaders
- Loaders before compilers
- Individual functions can be parallel within a module
- Validation last

### Parallel Opportunities

**Phase 1**:
- T004, T005, T006 (directory creation) in parallel

**Phase 2**:
- T008-T011 (all tests) in parallel
- T019, T020, T021 (primitive registration by category) in parallel

**Phase 3 (US1)**:
- T022-T027 (all tests) in parallel
- T039-T042 (list function implementations) in parallel

**Phase 4 (US2)**:
- T045-T052 (parity tests) in parallel
- T063-T070 (codegen removal) sequentially (same file)

**Phase 5 (US3)**:
- T074-T079 (all tests) in parallel

---

## Parallel Example: User Story 1

```bash
# Launch all US1 tests together:
Task: "T022 [P] [US1] Contract test for runtime module loading"
Task: "T023 [P] [US1] Contract test for dependency analysis"
Task: "T024 [P] [US1] Contract test for Wasm validation"
Task: "T025 [P] [US1] Unit test for runtime-function struct"
Task: "T026 [P] [US1] Unit test for compile-runtime-function"
Task: "T027 [P] [US1] Unit test for undefined primitive detection"

# After tests pass, launch list function implementations together:
Task: "T039 [P] [US1] Create list-ops.lisp with assoc"
Task: "T040 [P] [US1] Add member to list-ops.lisp"
Task: "T041 [P] [US1] Add find to list-ops.lisp"
Task: "T042 [P] [US1] Add position to list-ops.lisp"
```

---

## Implementation Strategy

### MVP First (User Story 1 Only)

1. Complete Phase 1: Setup (T001-T007)
2. Complete Phase 2: Foundational (T008-T021)
3. Complete Phase 3: User Story 1 (T022-T044)
4. **STOP and VALIDATE**: Add `assoc` to runtime, verify Wasm compiles
5. Demonstrate: New functions can be added without touching func-section.lisp

### Incremental Delivery

1. Setup + Foundational → Primitives registry ready
2. User Story 1 → Can add runtime functions → **MVP!**
3. User Story 2 → I/O migrated, 40% line reduction → Major milestone
4. User Story 3 → Self-hosting enabled → Bootstrap goal achieved

### Success Metrics

| Metric | Target | Verification |
|--------|--------|--------------|
| SC-001 | func-section.lisp < 11,000 lines | `wc -l func-section.lisp` |
| SC-002 | Add function without codegen changes | Add new runtime function |
| SC-003 | Migrated functions pass tests | `rove tests/integration/runtime/` |
| SC-004 | Stage 1 rate +10 points | `sbcl --load build/stage1-complete.lisp` |
| SC-006 | Build time increase <20% | Stage 1 timing comparison |

---

## Notes

- [P] tasks = different files, no dependencies
- [Story] label maps task to specific user story
- Constitution VII requires TDD: tests MUST fail before implementation
- HyperSpec links required per Constitution IX
- Commit after each task or logical group
- Stop at any checkpoint to validate independently
